title: TC001-App Launch and Theme Selection with Biometric Authentication
description: Verify app launch flow where user selects a theme and successfully authenticates using biometric security.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)

        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass

        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:3000
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Open the app in a new browser tab to attempt a fresh load of the SPA and reveal interactive elements (if any).
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Reload the app URL (last-resort navigation) to attempt to get the SPA to load and reveal interactive elements.
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC003-Create New Journal Entry with Text and Rich Media
description: Verify creating a new journal entry including text content and adding supported rich media such as images and sketches.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)

        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass

        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:3000
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Reload the page (controlled navigation to the same URL) to attempt to load the SPA. If still blank after reload, open the URL in a new tab.
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Open http://localhost:3000 in a new tab and wait for the SPA to load; then re-check the page for interactive elements (buttons, inputs, links).
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Attempt a controlled reload of the app using direct navigation (go_to_url) to force the SPA to reinitialize. After navigation, check the page for interactive elements. If still blank, escalate to opening in a new tab or report a website issue.
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC004-Search Journal Entries with Advanced Filters
description: Verify searching journal entries by keywords and applying advanced filters including category and date ranges.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)

        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass

        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:3000
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Reload the app by opening the app URL in a new tab to force a fresh load (last-resort navigation since SPA did not render). If the new tab also shows no interactive elements, report issue.
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())
